Welcome to
ADA for Warriors

A mission-driven single pool for Cardano that donates 50% of it's op's rewards to the Third Option Foundation and 25% of it's op's rewards to Captive Audience.

ADA for Warriors (4WARD)

ADA for Warriors is a mission-driven single pool for Cardano. The pool was created as a way to give back to those who have quietly served by donating fifty percent of the pool operator's rewards to the Third Option Foundation. All donations can be tracked on our main Swift Crypto LLC website (which also contains our latest news and information).

The pool consists of one block producer with two relay nodes deployed to AWS. Each AWS instance is using 4 CPUs and 16 GB RAM, which exceeds the current hardware requirements. One relay and the block producer are in the AWS US East Region and the other relay is in the AWS European Central Region. Security and recovery best practices were put in place to help guarantee server availability. Grafana is used to remotely monitor the status of all three servers. Should disaster recovery be needed, secure remote access is available to our admins from anywhere in the world. Our current pool status can be checked with Pool Vet.

To help support the community, and get support, we joined the Cardano Single Pool Alliance and the xSPO Alliance. Both alliances are full of like-minded pool operators who have pledged to run a single pool to help decentralize Cardano. Both alliances have been great sources of information on upcoming projects for Cardano and a great source for tech tips for running our pool.

We are also a member of the Freeloaderz coalition to help support the Cardano community. This coalition is made up of Cardano stake pools that are offering Cardano TX Submit API access to their Relay servers. This API service helps improve transaction speed by allowing supporting user wallets to submit transactions directly to a Relay.

Third Option Foundation

The Third Option Foundation seeks to heal, help, and honor members of the CIA's Special Operations community and their families.

It was founded to fill the gap created by the fact that these operators function in a covert manner. Their covert nature leaves them ineligible for most charitable assistance available to US military members and their families.

The assistance given can be in the form of financial and logistical support, academic and college prep for children, home maintenance, counseling and family services, physical health and wellness support, legacy activities to honor fallen warriors, and the establishment of memorials.

To learn more about their mission, please visit their website.

Captive Audience

Captive Audience offers an array of security, travel, self-defense, firearms, and survival courses designed to develop the skills needed to maintain situational awareness and survive in kidnapping, extortion, active shooter, natural disaster, and crisis situations at home and abroad.

Captive Audience was established by a retired army special forces operator with specialized training and experience in personnel recovery, CAPTaRT is comprised of a team with three decades of experience in defense, intelligence, SERE, travel/personnel/facility security, counter terrorism, personnel recovery, infiltration/exfiltration, critical incident stress management, risk and threat assessments, and many more skills crucial to the company’s mission to eradicate violence perpetrated against travelers.

Requests for their services have spiked since Russia invaded Ukraine in early 2022. In response to these requests, Captive Audience has started #OperationCaffeinatedVikings.

To learn more about their mission, please visit their website.

Frequently Asked Questions

ADA is the token for the Cardano network. Cardano is a third generation, decentralized proof-of-stake (PoS) blockchain. Cardano was started in 2015 by one of the co-founders of Ethereum, Charles Hoskinson. Cardano and it's ADA token were launched in 2017. Cardano has gone through multiple development "eras". Each era goes through peer reviewed academic research, prototyping, and development.

Proof-of-stake is a type of consensus mechanism used by some cryptocurrency blockchain networks. Cardano uses Block Producers (part of a "Stake Pool") to create new transaction blocks and validate transactions via the Ourboros protocol. Holders of ADA can help secure the network by delegating their ADA to a Stake Pool (like our 4WARD pool). In return, holders are rewarded with ADA when the Stake Pool generates new blocks.

You will need to buy some ADA on an exchange first. After your deposit clears, you will be able to send your ADA to a wallet like Yoroi. Within Yoroi and other ADA wallets, you can choose a pool and delegate to it. The entire process generally takes 5 to 10 days depending on the exchange you choose. When you delegate your ADA, there is no lock period and you never give anyone else control over your ADA. You always maintain the "keys".

For full step-by-step instructions, see our Staking Guide.

Cardano uses Epochs to define a period of time that a set of randomly selected pools will be active. The random selection is weighted with a number of parameters, one being the total delegation to the pool. The more delegation a pool has, the higher chance it has to be active for a given epoch. When your delegated pool is selected to be active and it creates blocks during that epoch, you will get rewards from that epoch in 2 epochs time.

The timeline looks like this:

  • You delegate your ADA to a pool during Epoch A (1 to 5 days)
  • Epoch B, your pool is active and you earn rewards (5 days)
  • Epoch C, rewards for Epoch B are calculated (5 days)
  • Epoch D, Rewards for Epoch B are paid out (5 days)

There are a number of amazing veteran charities. They help veterans and their families with financial issues; physical, emotional, and psychological issues; housing; education; and many other things that many of us take for granted.

The Third Option Foundation specifically supports the operators (and their families) of the CIA Special Activities Center. These operators put themselves in the most dangerous situations in the world, usually behind enemy lines. Their work is covert, leaving them with not much more community support than their families. Also, because of their covert nature, they often aren't eligible for support from military veteran charities.

The Third Option Foundation is the only organization that fills that gap. They provide crucial survivorship assistance and resiliency programs to heal the wounded, help the families of those we have lost, and support those who are still serving.

About a year ago, I met Billy Jensen and Check Freedman, the founders of Captive Audience, at Kore Krav Maga in Ashburn. They created Captive Audience to provide security, travel, self-defense, firearms, and survival courses designed to develop the skills needed to maintain situational awareness and survive in kidnapping, extortion, active shooter, natural disaster, and crisis situations at home and abroad.

Requests for their services have spiked since Russia invaded Ukraine in early 2022. In response to these requests, Captive Audience has started #OperationCaffeinatedVikings.

To quote their website:

The ADA for Warriors pool currently has a minimum fee of 340 ADA and a 0% variable fee. When our pool is active, the income for the pool will be 340 ADA for the epoch (the remaining ADA will get distributed to all of the delegators based on their delegation percentage vs the total delegation).

To reduce the amount of fees paid, donations will be made during the last epoch of each month. Half of the pool income for the previous month will be transfered to an exchange and sold. The proceeds of that sale will be donated directly to the Third Option Foundation (50%) and Captive Audience (25%).
